bill_title: require the Department of Education to provide for computer access for certain rural attendance centers in South Dakota and to make an appropriation therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require the Department of Education to provide for computer access for certain rural attendance centers in South Dakota and to make an appropriation therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The Department of Education shall determine which rural attendance centers do not have access to the internet, as defined in § 22-25A-3, or to the State of South Dakota's video telecommunications services. The Department of Education shall select a minimum of twenty percent of the rural attendance centers identified by the department pursuant to this Act and provide internet access and video telecommunication before June 30, 2005. Each year thereafter twenty percent of the total rural attendance centers identified shall receive internet access and video telecommunication services and all rural attendance centers shall have internet access and video telecommunication by June 30, 2009. Section 2. On June thirtieth of each year, four hundred thirty-six thousand dollars ($436,000), or so much as thereof as may be available, shall be transferred from the appropriation for state aid for general education that is not expended or legally obligated to the rural attendance center wiring fund which is hereby created as a separate fund in the state treasury. Any money in the rural attendance center wiring fund is continuously appropriated to the Department of Education to pay for the provisions of this Act. Section 3. The secretary of the Department of Education shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
